purpose: The commit adds a guard in the Bluetooth HCI command synchronization queue function to immediately return an error when the device has been unregistered (HCI_UNREGISTER flag set). This prevents queuing commands that would otherwise operate on a freed device, avoiding a use‑after‑free failure.

The commit removes an unnecessary #include of <asm/termios.h> from drivers/tty/n_hdlc.c, relying on the fact that linux/tty.h already pulls in linux/termios.h. This cleanup eliminates a redundant header inclusion and simplifies the include hierarchy.

The commit updates the perf-c2c documentation to include the new 'N/A' metric for store operations, adding descriptions and adjusting related sections. No code changes are made, only documentation edits.

This patch fixes several bugs in the huge page (hugetlb) subsystem related to VMA lock handling during VMA splitting and range unmapping. It prevents a race in `hugetlb_unmap_file_folio` by correctly acquiring and releasing locks, ensures that all VM_MAYSHARE VMA mappings have a dedicated lock to avoid double‑freeing when `vm_area_dup()` copies the lock pointer, and changes the unmap logic to unlock and free the VMA lock instead of merely clearing the VM_MAYSHARE flag. The patch also updates the pmd sharing logic to require the presence of a VMA lock and refines the lock‑free helper to check shareable flags. Overall, it corrects race conditions, memory‑management bugs, and improves future safety by enforcing lock presence on all shareable VMA mappings.

The commit updates the device tree binding documentation for the Realtek rt5682s codec by adding two new supply properties, AVDD-supply and MICVDD-supply, and marking them as required. It also provides example usage of these properties. No source code changes are made.

The commit adds a missing iounmap() call in the zorro7xx_remove_one() function to unmap a previously mapped I/O region when the base address is above 0x01000000. This fixes a resource leak that could occur when the probe path fails and the remove function is later invoked, ensuring the I/O mapping is properly released.

The commit removes an unused 'work' field from the 'mlx5e_async_ctx' structure in the kTLS transmit code. This change cleans up the data structure by deleting a field that is never referenced, simplifying the code and potentially reducing memory usage.

The commit changes the type of the key_idx field in the cfg80211_auth_request structure from an unsigned 8‑bit integer (u8) to a signed 8‑bit integer (s8). This allows the field to hold the value –1, which is used when the key pointer is NULL to indicate that the key index is not applicable. The change is made to eliminate static analysis warnings (e.g., from smatch) that arise when an unsigned field is assigned a negative value. No new functionality is added, and the change does not modify program logic beyond this type adjustment.

The commit removes the line '# CONFIG_SURFACE_PLATFORMS is not set' from two RISC‑V defconfig files, effectively sorting the CONFIG_SURFACE_PLATFORMS entry to match the order used by savedefconfig. No functional behavior changes are introduced; the commit is purely cosmetic.

The commit introduces a static inline helper function mcp251xfd_is_fd_mode() that encapsulates the logic for determining whether the MCP251XFD controller is operating in CAN‑FD or listen‑only mode. It replaces repeated inline checks in several source files (chip‑fifo.c, ring.c, and the header) with calls to this function, thereby centralizing the condition and improving code readability and maintainability.

The commit modifies the RTC self-test to skip tests when the RTC device file is missing (ENOENT). It removes an unconditional assertion in the fixture setup and adds checks before each test that call SKIP if the file is absent, preventing test failures in environments without an RTC.

The commit removes a redundant assignment to the variable 'bytes' in the ALSA echoaudio midi output function. The original code performed a dead store by assigning 0 to 'bytes' and then immediately reassigning it inside a conditional block. The change replaces 'sent = bytes = 0;' with 'sent = 0;', eliminating the unused variable assignment and resolving a clang warning about dead stores.

This commit removes the unconditional dependency of the rcuscale test on the RCU Tasks subsystem. It edits the Kconfig to stop selecting TASKS_RCU when RCU_SCALE_TEST is enabled, adds conditional compilation around the tasks_ops structure in rcuscale.c so that it is only defined when CONFIG_TASKS_RCU is set, and updates the self‑test configuration to use FORCE_TASKS_RCU instead of the full TASKS_RCU option. The net effect is that the rcuscale test can be built and run without pulling in the RCU Tasks code, reducing kernel size and simplifying tracing.
The commit removes a duplicated phrase "be split" from a comment in the file arch/x86/kvm/mmu/spte.h, correcting a typo in documentation.

The commit reverts a recent change that populated the DCN315 clock table using the DCFCLK values. The original change caused a failure when the PMFW firmware left DCFCLK states disabled, leading to an underflow/no‑read situation. By restoring the previous logic (which uses the DfPstate table and a different lookup for clock values), the commit fixes the immediate bug and also prevents a similar bug from occurring in the future until a more robust solution is implemented.

The commit updates the Mali‑Bifrost device‑tree binding YAML to add a new compatible string for the Renesas RZ/V2L (R9A07G054) SoC, expanding the list of supported GPUs and adjusting the enum for the "compatible" property accordingly.

The assistant correctly identified that the commit is a refactor that renames the struct `pcie_port` to `dw_pcie_rp` across the DesignWare PCIe controller code. It also noted that the change propagates through many driver files, header files, and function prototypes. The assistant provided a concise summary of the main changes and their impact on the codebase.
The commit changes a printf-style format specifier in a debug print statement from %#06hx to %#06x to match the promoted integer type of the argument, eliminating a clang -Wformat warning.

The commit modifies the branch range check in arch/mips/kernel/jump_label.c by casting the upper bound of the range to a signed long before performing the comparison. This change prevents the warning from being incorrectly triggered when the offset is negative, fixing a bug in the range validation logic.

The commit removes the HW_VAR_H2C_FW_P2P_PS_OFFLOAD case from the SetHwReg8188EU function and eliminates the corresponding enum value. All calls that previously used SetHwReg with this variable are replaced with direct calls to rtl8188e_set_p2p_ps_offload_cmd. This simplifies the HAL interface by removing an unnecessary abstraction layer.

The commit changes the declaration of the array `cavium_erratum_23154_cpus` from a non‑static const to a static const in arch/arm64/kernel/cpu_errata.c. This resolves a sparse warning that the symbol was not declared static, preventing it from being exported globally.

This commit updates the device tree bindings documentation for the MDSS display subsystem on MSM platforms. It removes the incorrect specification of interrupt flags (e.g., IRQ_TYPE_LEVEL_HIGH or IRQ_TYPE_NONE) from the "interrupts" property of MDSS consumer nodes. The MDSS interrupt provider is a single-cell provider, so consumers should not provide a flags cell. The change corrects the documentation to reflect the proper syntax, preventing misinterpretation by developers and tools.

The commit introduces support for allocating memory for array controls in the V4L2 control subsystem. It renames the dynamic‑array specific fields and logic to generic array fields (p_req_array_* and is_array), updates allocation helpers, request handling, and reference cleanup to work with arrays whose size can be changed by a driver. The changes also adjust error handling for allocation failures. Overall, it adds a new feature while refactoring existing code.

The commit extends the Qualcomm socinfo driver by adding support for additional PMIC models and SoC identifiers. It inserts new entries into the pmic_models array and the soc_id table, enabling the driver to recognize and report these devices on supported boards.

The commit updates the rtl8xxxu_print_chipinfo function to correctly map the chip_cut field (0–15) to the corresponding letter (A–P) instead of printing "unknown" for values greater than 4. It replaces a switch statement with a simple arithmetic calculation and updates the format string to use a character placeholder.

This commit removes the redundant .is_enabled field and its associated enable/disable/is_enabled functions from the PRCMU clock driver. The core clock infrastructure already tracks a software enable count, so the custom state is unnecessary. The change cleans up the code by deleting the field, its getters/setters, and references in the clk_ops structures, and also clears the initial is_enabled flag in clk_reg_prcmu. No new functionality is added, and the commit does not directly fix a known bug but eliminates a source of potential future inconsistency.

This patch refactors the RISC‑V MM init code to reduce the use of the CONFIG_XIP_KERNEL conditional compilation. It removes a separate #ifdef block that declared XIP‑specific symbols, moves the pt_ops macro definition into the existing CONFIG_XIP_KERNEL block, and groups related XIP‑only declarations together. The change is purely structural and does not add new functionality or fix a known runtime bug.

The commit modifies the device tree for the SM6350 Sony Xperia Lena PDX213 to enable the QUP (Quad Peripheral Unit) and GPI DMA (General-Purpose Input/Output Direct Memory Access) hardware blocks by setting their status to "okay". This change allows these hardware blocks to be used later, for example to support I2C nodes. The diff shows only the addition of status="okay" lines for &gpi_dma0, &gpi_dma1, &qupv3_id_0, and &qupv3_id_1.

The commit updates comments in the rzg2l thermal driver: it changes the macro comment from "Capture times" to "Total number of ADC data samples", corrects a typo from "caliberation" to "calibration", and reformats block comments to start on a new line. No functional code changes are made.

The commit replaces an unconditional busy-wait loop that attempts to acquire a hardware semaphore with a single check that logs an error and exits if the semaphore cannot be obtained. This change prevents an infinite loop that could occur when the hardware is unexpectedly removed, thereby fixing a bug that caused a potential denial of service or system crash.

The commit updates the pcm3168a ASoC codec driver to replace the legacy "master/slave" terminology with the newer "provider/consumer" terminology for DAI clocking. It changes variable names, switch cases, error messages, and related logic to use the new constants (e.g., SND_SOC_DAIFMT_CLOCK_PROVIDER_MASK, SND_SOC_DAIFMT_CBC_CFC, SND_SOC_DAIFMT_CBP_CFP). The code remains functionally equivalent; only the naming and terminology are modernized.
Removes a dead macro definition for IS_SWAPFILE that was always defined, cleaning up code.

This commit implements GTP echo request/response handling for both GTPv0 and GTPv1, adds a restart counter field to the GTP device structure, introduces new netlink attributes and protocol constants, and updates routing logic to correctly send echo responses when no userspace daemon is present. It also adds necessary structs and helper functions for constructing and sending the echo response packets, ensuring compliance with GTP specifications.

This commit replaces calls to the cpumask_next_* family of functions with the more appropriate cpumask_first_* variants where the logic allows. It also introduces a new helper cpumask_first_zero() to find the first unset CPU in a mask. The changes are applied in several kernel files (blk-mq.c, virtio_net.c, qbman portal drivers, and clocksource.c) and the cpumask.h header is updated to provide the new function. The intent is to improve correctness and performance by using the right iterator functions and to provide a missing utility.

The commit removes the call to the firmware iovar "dtim_assoc" in the brcmfmac driver. This call is no longer supported by the firmware and always fails, producing error messages after a station roams. By eliminating the call, the driver no longer attempts to retrieve TIM information from firmware, stopping the error logs.

This commit adds a new board configuration (adl_rt5682) for the Intel SOF RT5682 driver to support the alc5682 headset codec on platforms that lack a speaker amplifier. It updates the platform device ID table in sof_rt5682.c and extends the ACPI match table in soc-acpi-intel-adl-match.c to include the new board, enabling the driver to load the appropriate firmware and topology files for this configuration.

The patch adds a guard in io_sendmsg_zc to return -EOPNOTSUPP when the socket does not support zerocopy (SOCK_SUPPORT_ZC). This mirrors a similar change for zerocopy send requests, ensuring that unsupported protocols fail gracefully instead of potentially misbehaving.

This commit updates the Sphinx kernel documentation preamble to guard against loading the xeCJK package when it is not installed. It adds a boolean flag and checks for the existence of xeCJK.sty before enabling CJK support, and updates the missing‑fonts note to mention the optional texlive‑xecjk package. The change prevents a runtime error on systems where the font is present but the xeCJK package is missing, and it also improves the documentation message for users.

This commit modifies the kernel checkpatch script to suppress false‑positive lint errors for macros that start with the keyword "case" (e.g., "#define C2S(x) case x: return #x"). It adds a regular expression exclusion to the list of patterns that trigger the "Macros with complex values should be enclosed in parentheses" warning.

This commit replaces the legacy simple-KMS helper functions in the tiny DRM driver with the newer atomic helpers. It removes the old simple display pipe structure, introduces a primary plane, CRTC, encoder, and connector using the atomic framework, and updates the mode configuration and helper functions accordingly. The change is purely architectural and does not alter the driver’s external behavior; it is a refactor to improve code structure and future maintainability.

This commit adds a JPEG decode worker interface to the MediaTek JPEG driver for MT8195, enabling three hardware decoders to run concurrently. It introduces new helper functions for allocating and releasing hardware resources, setting parameters, and a worker routine that manages decoding jobs. The commit also updates the device structure to include wait queues, workqueues, atomic counters, and spinlocks for safe concurrent access, and modifies the IRQ handler and timeout work to correctly reset hardware state and wake waiting threads. Additionally, it registers a new variant for the JPEG decoder and updates probe logic to initialize the new resources.

The commit removes a series of VPRINTK debug logging calls and the helper function ata_scsi_dump_cdb() from the libata subsystem. All removed lines are conditional debug prints that are already covered by tracepoints or are otherwise redundant. No new functionality is added, no bugs are fixed, and the change only cleans up code and reduces unnecessary logging.

This commit adds support for using the extended vblank period during AMD FreeSync to enter zstate (z9/z10) when the extra time is sufficient. It introduces new capability flags, debug options, and data structures for extended blank optimization, adds logic to calculate optimized timing parameters, and updates hardware sequencing and resource construction to enable the feature. The changes also add new functions and fields to propagate the new timing adjustments through the stream update flow.

The commit updates the function pointer prototype for hqd_destroy in kgd_kfd_interface.h, changing the third parameter type from uint32_t to enum kfd_preempt_type. This aligns the prototype with the actual implementations, eliminating a Control Flow Integrity (CFI) violation that occurs when the kernel is compiled with CONFIG_CFI_CLANG on certain GPUs.

The commit corrects a typo in the pinctrl device tree binding for STM32: the property name "reset" is changed to the correct "resets". It also adds an "additionalProperties: false" constraint to the patternProperties section, preventing any unspecified properties from being accepted. This fixes a potential parsing error and improves validation of device tree nodes.

The commit adds a conditional build flag to the ath9k Makefile that disables the GCC 12 array‑bounds warning for the mac.o object. It does this by appending -Wno-array-bounds to CFLAGS_mac.o when KBUILD_EXTRA_WARN is not defined, effectively silencing the warning that GCC 12 incorrectly reports for a subscript that appears to be out of bounds.

The commit replaces the call to pm_runtime_get_sync with pm_runtime_resume_and_get in the sun8i-ss PRNG driver. This change removes an unnecessary pm_runtime_put_noidle call and uses a function that both resumes the device and increments its usage count, simplifying the code and ensuring correct runtime PM handling.

The commit reorganizes the io_uring fixed‑file handling code. It moves the installation logic into a new helper that takes a ring context instead of a request, introduces a dedicated removal helper, and updates the public install function to lock/unlock around the helper. It also updates the close helper to use the new removal helper. The changes fix a missing unlock bug in the original install path and improve code structure and clarity.

This commit updates the devicetree binding for the NXP i.MX8MQ VPU to split the previously single "nxp,imx8mq-vpu" node into two independent nodes, "nxp,imx8mq-vpu-g1" and "nxp,imx8mq-vpu-g2". It removes the old multi-item properties (reg, interrupts, clocks, etc.) and replaces them with single-item properties, adds power-domain support, and updates the example DT snippets accordingly. The change also marks the old compatible string as deprecated.

The commit removes the unused macro IWL_DEVICE_BZ_COMMON and replaces it with a single IWL_DEVICE_BZ macro that contains the same configuration values. It simply consolidates the macro definition, eliminating an unnecessary intermediate macro that was only referenced once. No new functionality is added, no bugs are fixed or prevented, and the change is purely a refactoring for clarity and maintainability.
